node.title: Join us at HighEdWeb Oct. 21-24
node.excerpt: 100+ presentations, two world-class keynotes and a great community. HighEdWeb provides valuable professional development for all who want to explore the unique digital issues facing colleges and universities.
node.content:
Mark your calendars and join us for one of our favorite events: the 2018 Annual Conference of the Higher Education Web Professionals Association (HighEdWeb) in Sacramento, California, this October 21-24!

HighEdWeb is the annual conference created by and for higher education web and digital professionals. From developers, marketers and programmers to managers, designers, writers and all team members in-between, HighEdWeb provides valuable professional development for all who want to explore the unique digital issues facing colleges and universities. There’s no better place for networking, sharing ideas, and learning from the best in your field!

Register for HighEdWeb

HighEdWeb 2018 registration includes:

  • Access to 100+ presentations
  • Seats at two world-class keynotes
  • Daily breakfast, lunch and snacks
  • Membership in the Higher Education Web Professionals Association
  • Admittance to HighEdWeb 2018 evening off-site events like Sunday’s Welcome Reception and the Big Social Event

Reserve your spot by July 31 for early-bird pricing—$100 off standard registration. For more information, check out the conference website or reach out to conference@highedweb.org.

author.bio: I'm the Director/Founder of WPCampus and a freelance software engineer and accessibility/higher ed consultant. When I'm not using WordPress to help build the web, I enjoy promoting the importance of universal design and an open web. Be sure to say hi on Twitter @bamadesigner.

Jonathan Perlman is an experienced web developer and teacher who works for Dawson College in Montreal, Quebec. He builds custom web solutions for the students, faculty and staff. Recently he’s been leveraging WordPress more and more to do the heavy lifting while focusing on the needs of the institution with custom themes and plugins. Some of his sites have been built for a select few whereas others are visited by 12,000+ applicants. Jonathan is also an instructor for Dawson’s Centre for Training and Development specializing in web technologies such as HTML, CSS, PHP and WordPress.
I am a web developer who has been working with WordPress multisite in higher education since 2007.

Sara Clark has been providing digital leadership for higher education and nonprofits throughout her career. As operations director for Higher Education Web Professionals Association, she coordinates the day-to-day functions and helps lay the groundwork for future growth.

node.title: WordPress in Higher Education
node.excerpt: WPCampus is a community and conference for web professionals, educators and people dedicated to the confluence of WordPress in higher education. Today will be a very general overview of WPCampus and talking about the conference but we want this to be the beginning of a weekly show where we can discuss topics relevant to our […]
node.content:
WPCampus is a community and conference for web professionals, educators and people dedicated to the confluence of WordPress in higher education. Today will be a very general overview of WPCampus and talking about the conference but we want this to be the beginning of a weekly show where we can discuss topics relevant to our community, share tutorials and walkthroughs, broadcast the types of sessions you might see at a conference, and more!

For this episode, we are joined by WPCampus members Rachel Cherry, Jonathan Perlman, Curtiss Grymala, Sara Clark, and Chris Flannagan.

Episode Audio

siteMetadata.siteName: WPCampus: Where WordPress meets higher education
